In response to sunflower 12...

I understand your confusion about Wal-Mart and how you think they're great because they offer low prices. It's obvious that you haven't watched this film because you would have known how corrupt the Wal-Mart corporation is. 

You haven't thought about how they're able to offer such low prices and stay in business. They rip off their employees by paying them low wages--low enough that these people need government assistance. This enables Wal-Mart to avoid having to offer good health benefits. You should stop supporting a company that has driven out small businesses owned by and employing people who need to make livings. The list goes on.

In other words, you are an idiot.
By the way, sunflower12, your taxes go to Wal-Mart employees and their food stamps, looooooooooooooooooool!

Sunflower, you are naive and don't understand economics and politics.

While Wal-Mart may save you a couple of bucks every week, it is parasitic in nature and is bleeding the country (and the world) dry, and will eventually affect you and yours.

Organjic, Wal-Mart is not a working model of capitalism. Wal-Mart is communist if anything. 
Learn some history. During the Sovietization of Russia, big conglomerates like Wal-Mart (mostly Jewish merchants) swooped in and put the Mama and Papa businesses out. Then they jacked the prices up and the Russians were starved into a revolution that eventually killed them.

Wal-Mart is not free anything. It is slavery and parasitic.
